marketNews.title: Average Minimum Wage Rises +6.5% in 2025
marketNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto announced that the average minimum wage increase in 2025 is +6.5%. Generally, this increase tends to align with the upper bound estimates we previously wrote about in Stockbit Snips, which implies a larger alpha variable value. However, the government has not yet released regulations regarding the formula used to calculate this minimum wage increase. The Minister of Manpower, Yassierli, stated that the Minister of Manpower regulation regarding the new minimum wage will be released on Wednesday (4/12). This regulation will replace Government Regulation No. 51/2023 concerning wages, which was annulled by the Constitutional Court in October 2024 following the revocation of the employment cluster from the Omnibus Law. Yassierli hopes that regional governments (pemda) can immediately release wage adjustment rules for their respective regions, targeting the announcement of provincial minimum wage (UMP) and regency/city minimum wage (UMK) adjustments for 2025 before Christmas 2024. Following the news of this minimum wage increase, the Chairperson of the Indonesian Employers Association, Shinta Kamdani, assessed that a minimum wage adjustment of +6.5% is too large an increase, which could trigger layoffs (PHK) and hinder new job creation. On the other hand, the President of KSPI and President of the Labor Party, Said Iqbal, said that the laborers will cancel the plan for a national strike because a meeting point regarding the minimum wage increase has been reached. The realization of the minimum wage increase at the regional level may have a deviation compared to the increase rate set by the central government. Here are the details: Key Takeaway: The +6.5% figure will serve as a reference for each region later. Compared to the average realization of minimum wage increases across all regions in Indonesia in recent years, this magnitude of increase is higher than in 2024 and is considered a relatively high increase in the last 3 years, although not as high as in 2023. A higher minimum wage increase has the potential to increase purchasing power and have a positive impact on consumer issuers, such as ICBP and MYOR. On the other hand, this increase can suppress profitability for issuers with a high proportion of opex from employee salaries, such as ACES and MAPI.

marketNews.title: BPS Records Consumer Price Index (CPI) Inflation in Indonesia Fell to 1.55% YoY in November 2024
marketNews.content: BPS recorded that the Consumer Price Index (IHK) inflation in Indonesia fell to 1.55% YoY in November 2024 (vs. October 2024: 1.71% YoY), marking the lowest level since July 2021 although it exceeded consensus expectations which projected 1.5% YoY inflation. Month-on-month, IHK inflation increased to 0.3% MoM (vs. October 2024: 0.08% MoM), exceeding the consensus expectation of 0.26% MoM and marking the fastest pace in the last 8 months. The monthly inflation increase was supported by the group of expenditure for food, beverages, and tobacco (contribution of 0.22 percentage point) and jewelry gold commodities (contribution of 0.04 percentage point). Core inflation reached its highest level in the last 16 months at 2.26% YoY (vs. October 2024: 2.21% YoY), exceeding the consensus expectation of 2.2% YoY.

marketNews.title: S&P Global Notes Indonesian Manufacturing PMI Rose to 49.6 in November 2024
marketNews.content: S&P Global noted that the Indonesian manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) rose to 49.6 in November 2024 (vs. October 2024: 49.2), marking the fifth consecutive month of factory activity contraction, although it was the strongest reading during that period. The Director of Economics at S&P Global, Paul Smith, stated that the Indonesian manufacturing PMI in November 2024 was a mixed result, with output growing for the first time in the last five months, although sales continued the downward trend of the last five months. This caused employment numbers to decline at the fastest pace in the last 3 years. On the other hand, confidence regarding future prospects improved to the highest level in the last 9 months, with companies expecting new demand and orders to increase over the next year.

marketNews.title: Deputy Minister of BUMN Kartika Wirjoatmodjo States BBTN Needs at least IDR 150 Trillion to Finance the 3 Million Houses Program Annually
marketNews.content: Deputy Minister of BUMN, Kartika Wirjoatmodjo, stated that Bank Tabungan Negara (BBTN) needs funds of at least 150 trillion rupiah to be able to finance the program of 3 million houses per year. Kartika explained that this need cannot be met only by relying on third-party funds, thus requiring special financing, such as special bonds with tenors up to 15 years guaranteed by the government or foreign funding. In addition, Kartika also revealed discussions about other financing schemes by utilizing community JHT (Jamsostek) balances in BPJS Ketenagakerjaan as down payments, as well as fundraising in the capital market.

marketNews.title: S&P Global Notes China Manufacturing PMI Rose to 51.5 in November 2024
marketNews.content: S&P Global noted that the China manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) rose to 51.5 in November 2024 (vs. October 2024: 50.3), exceeding the consensus expectation of 50.5. This result marks the second consecutive month of factory activity expansion and the fastest growth since June 2024. This result was driven by the strongest growth in overseas orders since February 2023 and an increase in exports. Furthermore, output growth reached its highest level in the last 5 months.

marketNews.title: President Prabowo Subianto Announces Allocation for Free Nutritious Meal Program is IDR 10,000 Per Portion
marketNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto announced that the fund allocation for the free nutritious meal program is 10,000 rupiah per portion, lower than the previous plan of 15,000 rupiah per portion. The Head of the National Nutrition Agency, Dadan Hindayana, stated that the budget allocation for this program in the 2025 State Budget is still calculated at 15,000 rupiah per portion. However, its implementation is flexible, adjusting to the base food prices in each region, with the possibility of cross-regional subsidies. In the 2025 State Budget itself, the budget for the free lunch program reaches 71 trillion rupiah, targeting approximately 19.47 million recipients ranging from school children to pregnant or breastfeeding mothers.

marketNews.title: US President-Elect Donald Trump States He Will Impose 100% Tariffs on BRICS Members if the Group Acts to Weaken the USD
marketNews.content: US President-elect, Donald Trump, said he would impose 100% tariffs on BRICS member countries if the group acts to weaken the US dollar. BRICS itself consists of Brazil, Russia, India, China, South Africa, Egypt, Ethiopia, Iran, and the United Arab Emirates. Indonesia has been a partner country (not a full member) in BRICS since October 2024, with the Minister of Foreign Affairs, Sugiono, saying that Indonesia wishes to join the group as it is the 'right vehicle' to advance the interests of developing countries.

marketNews.title: Advisor and Brother of President Prabowo Subianto, Hashim Djojohadikusumo, Says Government Plans to Form a State Revenue Ministry
marketNews.content: Advisor and brother of President Prabowo Subianto, Hashim Djojohadikusumo, said the government plans to form a State Revenue Ministry to boost revenue. The new ministry will manage state revenues, including taxes, excise duties, and mining royalties. Hashim mentioned that President Prabowo will appoint the Deputy Minister of Finance, Anggito Abimanyu, to lead the new ministry. However, Hashim did not specify when the government will form this ministry.

marketNews.title: BPS Records Foreign Tourist Visits to Indonesia Reached ~1.2 Million in October 2024
marketNews.content: BPS recorded that foreign tourist visits (wisman) to Indonesia reached ~1.2 million (-6.7% MoM, +22% YoY) in October 2024. During 10M24, foreign tourist visits to Indonesia increased +20.5% YoY to ~11.6 million, equivalent to 82.9% of the government's 2024 target of 14 million.

tickerNews.title: $BRMS - Bumi Resources Minerals records Net Profit +49.3% YoY in 9M24, Exceeding Expectations
tickerNews.content: BRMS: Bumi Resources Minerals recorded a net profit of US$6.7 million (+24.5% QoQ, +36% YoY) in 3Q24. This result brought the net profit for 9M24 to US$15.7 million (+49.3% YoY), exceeding our expectations as it reached 79.3% of Stockbit's FY24F estimate. Operationally, revenues and operating profit during 9M24 reached US$108.5 million (+231% YoY) and US$28.6 million (+189% YoY) respectively, achieving 112% and 108% of Stockbit's FY24F estimate. The results that exceeded our expectations were primarily driven by gold production volume which reached 45,366 troy ounces (+176% YoY), equivalent to 109% of Stockbit's FY24F estimate.

tickerNews.title: $BUMI records Q3 2024 Net Profit of $43 Million, Reversing from Net Loss in Q3 2023
tickerNews.content: BUMI: Bumi Resources recorded a net profit of US$43 million (+120% QoQ) in 3Q24, reversing from a net loss of US$24 million in 3Q23. This result brought BUMI's net profit for 9M24 to US$123 million (+111% YoY). Operationally, operating profit in 3Q24 grew +663% QoQ, supported by revenue growth of +16.2% QoQ. Meanwhile, the cost of revenue grew more slowly (+15% QoQ), while operating expenses decreased by -10.5% QoQ.

tickerNews.title: $BNGA reports October 2024 Bank-Only Net Profit of IDR 430 Billion; 10M24 Net Profit up +5.6% YoY
tickerNews.content: BNGA: Bank CIMB Niaga recorded a bank-only net profit of 430 billion rupiah (+3.5% YoY, -31% MoM) in October 2024, bringing the bank-only net profit for 10M24 to 5.4 trillion rupiah (+5.6% YoY). Net profit growth was pressured by non-operational expenses of 212 billion rupiah in October 2024 (vs. October 2023: profit of 4.8 billion rupiah, September 2024: profit of 218 billion rupiah). Operating profit in October 2024 grew +34% YoY and +22% MoM, so operating profit for 10M24 increased +4.8% YoY. Provision expenses moderated, with credit cost in October 2024 dropping to 0.44% (-23 bps YoY, -75 bps MoM) and credit cost for 10M24 reaching 0.66% (-30 bps YoY). Meanwhile, credit growth (including sharia funding) in 10M24 rose +5.6% YoY, in line with management's FY24 consolidated guidance in the range of +5-7%. In terms of profitability, NIM in October 2024 slightly decreased to 3.69% (-26 bps YoY, -2 bps MoM), resulting in NIM for 10M24 of 3.85% (-34 bps YoY).

tickerNews.title: $BBTN Plans to Issue Bonds up to IDR 15 Trillion Next Year for Housing Liquidity Facility (FLPP)
tickerNews.content: BBTN: The President Director of Bank Tabungan Negara, Nixon L. P. Napitupulu, said that his party plans to issue bonds of approximately 10-15 trillion rupiah throughout 2025 to meet liquidity needs to support the increase in the quota for the Housing Financing Liquidity Facility (FLPP). Nixon mentioned that the government plans to increase the FLPP quota from 220,000 units in 2024 to 800,000 houses in 2025. Nixon estimates that the budget required to implement the 800,000 unit FLPP housing program reaches 80 trillion rupiah. However, it should be noted that FLPP is not implemented solely by BBTN.

tickerNews.title: $MBMA plans private placement up to ~10.8 Billion shares (10%) with dilution effect up to 9.1%
tickerNews.content: MBMA: Merdeka Battery Materials plans to conduct a private placement of up to ~10.8 billion (10%) shares with a dilution effect of up to 9.1%. Prospective investors and the implementation price have not been announced, while the raised funds are intended for business development and working capital. This plan will be discussed at the GMSLB on December 6, 2024.

tickerNews.title: $MDKA plans to issue bonds worth ~IDR 1 Trillion, proceeds to be lent to subsidiary for debt repayment and working capital
tickerNews.content: MDKA: Merdeka Copper Gold plans to issue bonds worth approximately 1 trillion rupiah, with the proceeds to be lent to its subsidiary, PT Bumi Suksesindo, for accelerated payment of bank debt and working capital. This bond consists of Series A (367-day tenor) and Series B (3-year tenor), with the principal amount and interest rate yet to be announced. The estimated public offering period is December 18-19, 2024. This bond has received an idA+ rating from Pefindo.

tickerNews.title: $BTPN plans to issue bonds worth ~IDR 1.4 Trillion for business growth through lending
tickerNews.content: BTPN: Bank SMBC Indonesia plans to issue bonds worth approximately 1.4 trillion rupiah, with the proceeds intended for business growth in the form of providing credit. This bond consists of Series A worth ~430 billion rupiah (6.7% interest with a 3-year tenor) and Series B worth ~967 billion rupiah (6.95% interest with a 5-year tenor). The estimated public offering period is December 11-12, 2024. This bond has received an idAAA rating from Pefindo.

tickerNews.title: Deputy Minister of BUMN Kartika Wirjoatmodjo reveals plans concerning BBTN financing needs for housing program
tickerNews.content: Deputy Minister of BUMN, Kartika Wirjoatmodjo, stated that Bank Tabungan Negara (BBTN) needs funds of at least 150 trillion rupiah to be able to finance the program of 3 million houses per year. Kartika explained that this need cannot be met only by relying on third-party funds, thus requiring special financing, such as special bonds with tenors up to 15 years guaranteed by the government or foreign funding. In addition, Kartika also revealed discussions about other financing schemes by utilizing community JHT (Jamsostek) balances in BPJS Ketenagakerjaan as down payments, as well as fundraising in the capital market.
